encodingDesc.geoDecl: World Geodetic System: degrees - minutes - seconds

revisionDesc.change: added geo[@decls='#dd'] with DMS data and converted to decimal format

place.note: This is one of the locations for the Ḥwēṭāt Tribe.
This is one of the locations for the Bani Ṣaxar.
The location for the Rwaḷa. In Behnsted's atlas, the Rwaḷa are actually recorded to be in alManṣūr which on geonames is a neighbourhood of an-Nasriye.
This is the location for the Fidʕān.
This is a location of the Šammar.
This is the location for the ʕAfaḏ̣le.
This is one of the locations for the Bani ʕAbbād.
Data for Qaṣṣīm was collected here and in neighbouring Badāyiʕ.
Also as the location for Muʕayḏir, a suburb where data for the Al Murra was collected.
əl-Māy one of the Malikite dialects of Djerba
ər-Riyạ̄ḏ one of the Malikite dialects in Djerba
One of the Ibadi dialects of Djerba
This is the location for the ʕUgēdāt tribe.
Some of the Malikite Dialects of Djerba
Hgerat (Hǧērāt) Tribe 45. Previously inhabited by the Hegara tribe but evacuated in the 90s and their inhabitants moved to bir el maksur - 50 in map
ʕAmiriyya Tribe Upper Galilee. 34 in map
This is the location for the An-Nʕēmāt.
ʕArāmša Tribe points 4 and 5 in map
One of the locations for the Sudanese Rashayda.
Location of the Manāḏ̣re. GeoNames lists it as being in Israel, it is the Golan heights though.
This is one of the locations for the Bani ʕAbbād.
One of the Malikite dialects in Djerba
Tribe Lwēs with Badr Lwēs and all the men in the tiny room full of smoke
This is one of the locations for the Sirḥān tribe.
Location for the ʕArab (Sunnis) in Bahrain.
Arab al Maslax emmigrated here after the Israeli attack of Karantina in 1982, some stayed but still consider themselves Arab Al Maslax
Location for the Nʕēm (Lebanon) - ʕArab Maslax
This is one of the locations for the Bani Ṣaxar.
City is representative of the seven villages in Owen's article "Arabic Dialects of Chad and Nigeria"
The Geonames links to the Krak des Chevaliers, the village is at its foot.
This is one of the locations for the Bani Ṣaxar.
This is one of the locations for the Mawāli.
Representative location for La Cote Sud de la mer rouge de Massawa a Rahayta
One of the locations of the Bani Ṣaxar.
Location of the Bani Xāled. GeoNames lists it as Mitzpeh Ramta and as being in Israel, it is the Golan heights though.
Location of the Abu Ǧabal tribe
This is the location for data from the Bal-Qarn.
This is one of the locations for the Sirḥān tribe.
There are two Sorans in Syria. This one is the location of the Bū Baṭṭūš tribe.
Tribe Lwēs. Fieldwork Diwan and lunch with women
This is a location of the Šammar.
This is the location for the Šaṛābīn.
This is the location for the Baggara in Syria.
This is one of the locations for the Mawāli.
This is one of the locations for the Bani Ṣaxar.
This is one of the locations for the Bani Ṣaxar.
This is one of the locations for the Bani ʕAbbād.
ʕArāmša Tribe from Rosenhaus. point 3 in map
This is one of the locations for the Mawāli.
capital of the Hyayna tribe is Tissa
This is a location of the Šammar tribe Saudi Arabia.
Location for the ʕAṛaḅ Khalde tribe
This is also the location for Dosiri data by Johnstone.
To be used as location for Ouaday
The village of Qahaba lies in the administrative division of Ad-Dāʔir, which is given here.
Shihaniya is 20km North of Utouriya, the location where Al Murra data was collected.
One of the locations for the Al Murra, a high plateau.
Data for the Bal-Aḥmar originate mainly from the village of Āl Tāǧir in Wadi ʕAbl.
